blocks.content: Where are the richest households in the UK?

The sharp differences in household incomes across the UK have been set out in official government statistics./n/nThe average household income, once taxes and benefits are accounted for, was £19,432 per person in 2016./n/n But in Kensington & Chelsea and Hammersmith & Fulham in west London the average income was more than three times this at £58,816. /n/n In contrast, in Nottingham - which has the lowest household income - the average income was £12,232.
